metadata.title: CVE-2023-1206 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A hash collision flaw was found in the IPv6 connection lookup table in theLinux kernelâ€™s IPv6 functionality when a user makes a new kind of SYN floodattack. A user located in the local network or with a high bandwidthconnection can increase the CPU usage of the server that accepts IPV6connections up to 95%.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-1206` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-246-generic - 4.4.0-246.280
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-246-generic - 4.4.0-246.280
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-246-lowlatency - 4.4.0-246.280
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-219-generic - 4.15.0-219.230~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-219-generic - 4.15.0-219.230~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-219-lowlatency - 4.15.0-219.230~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1125-kvm - 4.4.0-1125.135
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1162-aws - 4.4.0-1162.177
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-aws - 4.15.0-1162.175~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1171-azure - 4.15.0-1171.186~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1156-gcp - 4.15.0-1156.173~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1125-oracle - 4.15.0-1125.136~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-246.280').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-219.230~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1125.135').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1162.177').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.175~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1171.186~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1156.173~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1125.136~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
